verses.kjv: They say, If a man put away his wife, and she go from him, and become another man’s, shall he return unto her again? shall not that land be greatly polluted? but thou hast played the harlot with many lovers; yet return again to me, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “They say, ‘If a man puts away his wife, and she goes from him, and becomes another man’s, should he return to her again?’ Wouldn’t that land be greatly polluted? But you have played the prostitute with many lovers; yet return again to me,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "There's a well-known principle: if a man divorces his wife and she leaves and marries someone else, should he take her back? Wouldn't that completely defile the land? Yet you have given yourself to one lover after another like a prostitute — and still, come back to me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Lift up thine eyes unto the high places, and see where thou hast not been lien with. In the ways hast thou sat for them, as the Arabian in the wilderness; and thou hast polluted the land with thy whoredoms and with thy wickedness.
verses.web: “Lift up your eyes to the bare heights, and see! Where have you not been lain with? You have sat waiting for them by the road, as an Arabian in the wilderness. You have polluted the land with your prostitution and with your wickedness.
verses.ct: "Look up at the hilltops and tell me — is there any place where you haven't been violated? You sat waiting for lovers along the roadside like a bandit in the desert. You have polluted the land with your prostitution and your wickedness.

verses.kjv: Therefore the showers have been withholden, and there hath been no latter rain; and thou hadst a whore’s forehead, thou refusedst to be ashamed.
verses.web: Therefore the showers have been withheld and there has been no latter rain; yet you have had a prostitute’s forehead and you refused to be ashamed.
verses.ct: That's why the rains have been held back and the spring showers never came. Yet you have the brazen face of a prostitute — you refuse to feel any shame.

verses.kjv: Wilt thou not from this time cry unto me, My father, thou art the guide of my youth?
verses.web: Will you not from this time cry to me, ‘My Father, you are the guide of my youth?’
verses.ct: Won't you at least cry out to me now, 'My Father, you have guided me since I was young'?

verses.kjv: Will he reserve his anger for ever? will he keep it to the end? Behold, thou hast spoken and done evil things as thou couldest.
verses.web: “ ‘Will he retain his anger forever? Will he keep it to the end?’ Behold, you have spoken and have done evil things, and have had your way.”
verses.ct: 'Will he stay angry forever? Will he hold this grudge to the end?' That's what you say — but then you keep doing every evil thing you can."

verses.kjv: The LORD said also unto me in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen that which backsliding Israel hath done? she is gone up upon every high mountain and under every green tree, and there hath played the harlot.
verses.web: Moreover, LORD said to me in the days of Josiah the king, “Have you seen that which backsliding Israel has done? She has gone up on every high mountain and under every green tree, and has played the prostitute there.
verses.ct: During the reign of King Josiah, the LORD said to me, "Have you seen what faithless Israel has done? She went up on every high mountain and under every green tree and prostituted herself there.

verses.kjv: And I said after she had done all these things, Turn thou unto me. But she returned not. And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
verses.web: I said after she had done all these things, ‘She will return to me;’ but she didn’t return, and her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
verses.ct: After she did all this, I thought, 'She'll come back to me.' But she never did. And her treacherous sister Judah watched the whole thing.

verses.kjv: And I saw, when for all the causes whereby backsliding Israel committed adultery I had put her away, and given her a bill of divorce; yet her treacherous sister Judah feared not, but went and played the harlot also.
verses.web: I saw when, for this very cause, that backsliding Israel had committed adultery, I had put her away and given her a certificate of divorce, yet treacherous Judah, her sister, had no fear; but she also went and played the prostitute.
verses.ct: I saw that even though I had divorced faithless Israel and sent her away because of all her adultery, her treacherous sister Judah wasn't afraid at all. She went right ahead and prostituted herself too.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass through the lightness of her whoredom, that she defiled the land, and committed adultery with stones and with stocks.
verses.web: Because she took her prostitution lightly, the land was polluted, and she committed adultery with stones and with wood.
verses.ct: Because she treated her prostitution so casually, she defiled the land, committing adultery with idols of stone and wood.

verses.kjv: And yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah hath not turned unto me with her whole heart, but feignedly, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Yet for all this her treacherous sister, Judah, has not returned to me with her whole heart, but only in pretense,” says LORD.
verses.ct: Even after all of this, her treacherous sister Judah didn't return to me with her whole heart. She only pretended to," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, The backsliding Israel hath justified herself more than treacherous Judah.
verses.web: LORD said to me, “Backsliding Israel has shown herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told me, "Faithless Israel has proven herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.

verses.kjv: Go and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, Return, thou backsliding Israel, saith the LORD; and I will not cause mine anger to fall upon you: for I am merciful, saith the LORD, and I will not keep anger for ever.
verses.web: Go, and proclaim these words toward the north, and say, ‘Return, you backsliding Israel,’ says LORD; ‘I will not look in anger on you; for I am merciful,’ says LORD. ‘I will not keep anger forever.
verses.ct: Go and announce this message toward the north: 'Come back, faithless Israel,' says the LORD. 'I won't look at you in anger, because I am merciful,' says the LORD. 'I won't stay angry forever.

verses.kjv: Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed against the LORD thy God, and hast scattered thy ways to the strangers under every green tree, and ye have not obeyed my voice, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Only acknowledge your iniquity, that you have transgressed against LORD your God, and have scattered your ways to the strangers under every green tree, and you have not obeyed my voice,’ says LORD.”
verses.ct: Just admit your guilt — that you rebelled against the LORD your God, that you chased after foreign gods under every green tree, and that you refused to listen to my voice,' says the LORD."

verses.kjv: Turn, O backsliding children, saith the LORD; for I am married unto you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and I will bring you to Zion:
verses.web: “Return, backsliding children,” says LORD; “for I am a husband to you. I will take one of you from a city, and two from a family, and I will bring you to Zion.
verses.ct: "Come back, you unfaithful children," says the LORD, "because I am your husband. I will gather you — even if it's just 1 from a city or 2 from a whole clan — and I will bring you to Zion.

verses.kjv: And I will give you pastors according to mine heart, which shall feed you with knowledge and understanding.
verses.web: I will give you shepherds according to my heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.
verses.ct: Then I will give you shepherds after my own heart, who will lead you with knowledge and understanding.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when ye be multiplied and increased in the land, in those days, saith the LORD, they shall say no more, The ark of the covenant of the LORD: neither shall it come to mind: neither shall they remember it; neither shall they visit it; neither shall that be done any more.
verses.web: It will come to pass, when you are multiplied and increased in the land, in those days,” says LORD, “they will no longer say, ‘the ark of LORD’s covenant!’ It will not come to mind. They won’t remember it. They won’t miss it, nor will another be made.
verses.ct: When that day comes and you have grown and multiplied in the land," says the LORD, "no one will talk about the ark of the covenant of the LORD anymore. It won't cross anyone's mind. No one will remember it or miss it, and no one will make another one.

verses.kjv: At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of the LORD; and all the nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name of the LORD, to Jerusalem: neither shall they walk any more after the imagination of their evil heart.
verses.web: At that time they will call Jerusalem ‘LORD’s Throne;’ and all the nations will be gathered to it, to LORD’s name, to Jerusalem. They will no longer walk after the stubbornness of their evil heart.
verses.ct: At that time, Jerusalem will be called the throne of the LORD. All nations will gather there to honor the name of the LORD in Jerusalem, and they will no longer stubbornly follow their evil hearts.

verses.kjv: In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given for an inheritance unto your fathers.
verses.web: In those days the house of Judah will walk with the house of Israel, and they will come together out of the land of the north to the land that I gave for an inheritance to your fathers.
verses.ct: In those days, the people of Judah will walk alongside the people of Israel. Together they will come from the land of the north back to the land I gave your ancestors as an inheritance.

verses.kjv: But I said, How shall I put thee among the children, and give thee a pleasant land, a goodly heritage of the hosts of nations? and I said, Thou shalt call me, My father; and shalt not turn away from me.
verses.web: “But I said, ‘How I desire to put you among the children, and give you a pleasant land, a goodly heritage of the armies of the nations!’ and I said, ‘You shall call me “My Father”, and shall not turn away from following me.’
verses.ct: "I said to myself, 'How I long to treat you as my own children and give you a beautiful land — the finest inheritance among all the nations!' I said, 'You will call me "My Father" and never turn away from me.'

verses.kjv: Surely as a wife treacherously departeth from her husband, so have ye dealt treacherously with me, O house of Israel, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “Surely as a wife treacherously departs from her husband, so you have dealt treacherously with me, house of Israel,” says LORD.
verses.ct: But just as a wife betrays her husband, you have betrayed me, house of Israel," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: A voice was heard upon the high places, weeping and supplications of the children of Israel: for they have perverted their way, and they have forgotten the LORD their God.
verses.web: A voice is heard on the bare heights, the weeping and the petitions of the children of Israel; because they have perverted their way, they have forgotten LORD their God.
verses.ct: A sound is heard on the barren hilltops — the weeping and desperate prayers of the people of Israel. They have twisted their path and forgotten the LORD their God.

verses.kjv: Return, ye backsliding children, and I will heal your backslidings. Behold, we come unto thee; for thou art the LORD our God.
verses.web: Return, you backsliding children, and I will heal your backsliding. “Behold, we have come to you; for you are LORD our God.
verses.ct: "Come back, you unfaithful children, and I will heal your faithlessness." "Here we are! We're coming to you, because you are the LORD our God.

verses.kjv: Truly in vain is salvation hoped for from the hills, and from the multitude of mountains: truly in the LORD our God is the salvation of Israel.
verses.web: Truly help from the hills, the tumult on the mountains, is in vain. Truly the salvation of Israel is in LORD our God.
verses.ct: It's true — the worship on the hills and mountains was all a lie. The salvation of Israel truly comes from the LORD our God alone.

verses.kjv: For shame hath devoured the labour of our fathers from our youth; their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.
verses.web: But the shameful thing has devoured the labor of our fathers from our youth, their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.
verses.ct: That shameful idol worship has devoured everything our ancestors worked for since we were young — their flocks and herds, their sons and daughters.

verses.kjv: We lie down in our shame, and our confusion covereth us: for we have sinned against the LORD our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even unto this day, and have not obeyed the voice of the LORD our God.
verses.web: Let us lie down in our shame, and let our confusion cover us; for we have sinned against LORD our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even to this day. We have not obeyed LORD our God’s voice.”
verses.ct: Let us collapse in our shame and let our disgrace cover us, because we have sinned against the LORD our God — we and our ancestors — from our youth until this very day. We have never obeyed the voice of the LORD our God."
